creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund and gift of funds from Ellen and Fred Wells
description: Lozenge-shaped body with short flaring neck and small foot; slightly more rounded on one side; brown glaze with slight tan streaking
text: Bottles and flasks with a thick iron-brown or black glaze became popular during the Choson period. Because shards of such vessels have been found at Punch'ong kilns, it is likely that the same kilns produced both wares. This vessel with its unctuous glaze and cascade effect, is particularly pleasing.
title: Flask
